concern:
Not sure if anyone else feels this way but it can be a lonely journey in grad school especially because of the niche stresses, things we have to deal with. 

Created a group me that will hopefully foster some community for people to talk with one another and build some friendships or the very least camaraderie 

Here’s the link to join: You're invited to my new group 'Grad School Community' on GroupMe. Click here to join: https://groupme.com/join_group/86601776/iTupsbUn

dialogue_total.statement: Hello! I'm glad you're here. Please feel free to share what's on your mind or any concerns you might have.
client: Hey, thanks for having me. Honestly, I've been feeling a bit isolated in grad school. It's tough finding people who really get what it's like, you know?
therapist: It sounds like you're experiencing a lot of solitude at the moment. How does this impact your day-to-day life?
client: Yeah, it definitely affects my mood and motivation. Some days, it's hard to focus on my work or even feel excited about what I'm doing.
It sounds like it's really challenging to stay motivated when you're feeling isolated. What are some things you imagine might change in your life if you felt more connected to others?
If I felt more connected, I think I'd have more energy and optimism. Just having people to share experiences with or vent to would make the tough days a bit easier to handle.

It seems like you're looking for ways to build connections that could boost your energy and optimism. Based on what you said, possible options might include joining a study group or attending social events related to your studies. What do you think about trying one of these, or is there another approach that feels right to you?

Those are good suggestions, and I've been thinking along those lines too. That's why I started a GroupMe chat for other grad students—kind of like a virtual study group or social event. I’m hoping it'll help create some community vibes and make things less isolating.

That sounds like a fantastic initiative! Creating a GroupMe chat is a proactive step towards building that sense of community you're seeking. By fostering these connections, you're really paving the way for more energy and optimism in your daily life. Remember, it's perfectly okay to take things at your own pace and reach out when you feel comfortable. You're doing a great job navigating this, and it's clear you're committed to making positive changes. As you continue, keep in mind the importance of self-care and leaning on these budding connections whenever you need. Let's check in next time to see how this new approach is working and explore any further support you might need. You're not alone in this journey—I'm here to support you every step of the way.
Thanks, I really appreciate that. I'll definitely keep you posted on how things go with the GroupMe.
